attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement to stop and report it if you run over a cat!
attributes.additional_details:
This law should be expanded to cover the welfare of our cats to give them the best chance at survival rather than suffering by the roadside and it would give the family peace of mind/closure. Animals feel pain & should not be left to suffer unnecessarily. Cats are part of peoples family and it breaks hearts to disregard them like they are vermin or rubbish. 
"The greatness of a nation can be judged by the way its animals are treated"
attributes.background: In the UK you are required by law to report it to the police if you run over a dog. However, a cat does not fall within the remit of the Road Traffic Act and therefore you do not need to report the incident.

rejection.details:
We cannot accept duplicate petitions. We think this petition is similar to yours:  
 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/104735
 
You might like to sign this petition instead. It is more likely to get more signatures that way.
